[To the Developer - Use this section to combine your app's functions with various buttons, describe your app, describe the group behind the app, and provide basic details/instructions to end users]

This area is dedicated to providing a description of your app. It's generally encouraged to include the following information:

  1. A description of your app
  2. Why this app is needed [the app's purpose]
  3. Who this app is intended for [the app's audience]
  4. Any other pertinent information you may find necessary

 This App displays a message when the user clicks the button on the left.

This App displays a message when the user clicks the button on the left.

To use this template, clone/copy this directory and open the included files in your editor of choice.

Styling Your App's UI

*** NOTE TO CDP: I intend to remove the following from the appTemplate and place it into it's own app--the "Style" app--which will be part of the development toolkit and which will showcase the various ways an app can be styled. I intend to this after the appTemplate is more or less finalized. - smmadara ***

There are a number of ways to style your app's UI. jQuery User Interface elements can be used with any app are included, by default, with SnapBack Apps. Below are some of the more useful elements that can help organize the information within your app. View the source code to see how the examples are structured. Use the link to the right to toggle the specific styling content. View More

View More/View Less

Below are some examples of the "View More/View Less" feature which allows you hide select content on page load. It additionally gives the user a chance to hide information they don't find relevant or which otherwise may be unnecessary upon a cursory glance.

This is a line in which additional information is hidden by default. View More

Mauris mauris ante, blandit et, ultrices a, suscipit eget, quam. Integer ut neque. Vivamus nisi metus, molestie vel, gravida in, condimentum sit amet, nunc. Nam a nibh. Donec suscipit eros. Nam mi. Proin viverra leo ut odio. Curabitur malesuada. Vestibulum a velit eu ante scelerisque vulputate.

This is a line in which additional information is shown by default. View Less

  • Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
  • Consectetur adipisicing elit
  • Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt
  • Ut labore et dolore magna
  • Proin viverra leo ut odio
Accordion

Below are some examples of the "Accordion" feature which allows you expand/close organized information. The raw code is based upon the standard accordion widget inherent in jQuery UI.

Section 1

Mauris mauris ante, blandit et, ultrices a, suscipit eget, quam. Integer ut neque. Vivamus nisi metus, molestie vel, gravida in, condimentum sit amet, nunc. Nam a nibh. Donec suscipit eros. Nam mi. Proin viverra leo ut odio. Curabitur malesuada. Vestibulum a velit eu ante scelerisque vulputate.

Section 2

Sed non urna. Donec et ante. Phasellus eu ligula. Vestibulum sit amet purus. Vivamus hendrerit, dolor at aliquet laoreet, mauris turpis porttitor velit, faucibus interdum tellus libero ac justo. Vivamus non quam. Insuscipit faucibus urna.

Section 3

Tabs

Below are some examples of the "Tabs" feature which allows you house multiple content panels inside a single content area. The raw code is based upon the standard tabs widget inherent in jQuery UI.

Administrator Button Permission Settings

You must be running as administrator to change permissions. Click here to run the platform as administrator.

  • Enable Button - allows anyone to run if enabled and no one to run if disabled
  • Enable Normal User - allows a normal user to run the button or not
  • Run without Warning - if disabled a warning message will be presented
